nodes.body_text: Is 1/Phi_n(p ⊞_n q) >= 1/Phi_n(p) + 1/Phi_n(q) for monic real-rooted polynomials p, q of degree n? Phi_n(p) = sum_i (sum_{j!=i} 1/(lambda_i - lambda_j))^2.
Phi_n via algebraic identity: p'(lambda_i) = prod_{j!=i}(lambda_i - lambda_j) (exact, no limiting). Phi_n = sum of squared Coulomb forces, rational functions of root differences.

hx/content.match: Phi_n = sum of squared Coulomb forces, rational functions of root differences

input_ports.label: Phi_n = sum of squared Coulomb forces, rational functions of root differences
input_ports.text: Phi_n = sum of squared Coulomb forces, rational functions of root differences

output_ports.label: Phi_n = sum of squared Coulomb forces, rational functions of root differences
output_ports.text: Phi_n = sum of squared Coulomb forces, rational functions of root differences

nodes.body_text: Discriminant connection: by Cauchy-Schwarz, Phi_n >= n(n-1)^2 / sum_{i<j}(lambda_i - lambda_j)^2. So 1/Phi_n measures root spread.
Finite free convolution ⊞_n (Marcus-Spielman-Srivastava 2015): preserves real-rootedness, equals E[char poly of A + UBU*], linearizes finite free cumulants.
Random matrix model: p ⊞_n q = E_U[char(A + UBU*)] where char(A) = p, char(B) = q, U uniform over unitaries.

hx/content.match: q = E_U[char(A + UBU*)] where char(A) = p, char(B) = q, U uniform over unitaries

input_ports.label: q = E_U[char(A + UBU*)] where char(A) = p, char(B) = q, U uniform over unitaries

output_ports.text: q = E_U[char(A + UBU*)] where char(A) = p, char(B) = q, U uniform over unitaries

nodes.body_text: Cumulant additivity: kappa_k(p ⊞_n q) = kappa_k(p) + kappa_k(q). Finite free cumulants defined via non-crossing partitions.
[ERROR] Original claim: 1/Phi_n is concave in cumulants. Numerical tests show 1/Phi_n is NEITHER convex NOR concave in coefficient space. The concavity claim is unproven.
[ERROR] Direction wrong: concavity + f(0)=0 gives SUBadditivity f(a+b) <= f(a)+f(b), not superadditivity. For superadditivity need CONVEXITY + f(0)=0.

hx/content.match: f(0)=0 gives SUBadditivity f(a+b) <= f(a)+f(b), not superadditivity
0 gives SUBadditivity f(a+b) <= f(a)+f(b), not superadditivity

nodes.body_text: Numerical verification: 0/8000 violations for n=2,3,4,5. Inequality IS true. Superadditivity specific to ⊞_n (fails ~40% under plain coeff addition). Analytic proof remains open.
Degree-2 proof: 1/Phi_2 = (a_1^2 - 4a_2)/2 is linear in coefficients. ⊞_2 preserves this combination exactly. Surplus = 0 (symbolic verification).
Centering reduction: Phi_n is translation-invariant (depends only on root differences). ⊞_n commutes with translation (via A+αI in random matrix model). WLOG a_1=b_1=0.
Key identity: for centered cubics, Phi_3 * disc(p) = 18 * a_2^2. Therefore 1/Phi_3 = disc/(18*a_2^2) = -2a_2/9 - 3a_3^2/(2a_2^2). Verified symbolically in SymPy.
⊞_3 simplification: for centered cubics (a_1=b_1=0), all cross-terms vanish: c_2=a_2+b_2, c_3=a_3+b_3. ⊞_3 reduces to plain coefficient addition.

hx/content.match: a_1=b_1=0), all cross-terms vanish: c_2=a_2+b_2, c_3=a_3+b_3

output_ports.text: a_1=b_1=0), all cross-terms vanish: c_2=a_2+b_2, c_3=a_3+b_3

nodes.body_text: Conclusion: PROVED for n=2 (equality), n=3 (strict, Titu's lemma), and n=4 (strict, P-convexity of K_red via 3-piece Cauchy-Schwarz). Numerically verified for n=5 (0/2000 violations). n>=5 analytic proof open.

nodes.body_text: n=4 reformulation: Phi_4 * disc(p) = -4 * f1_p * f2_p (key identity, SymPy-verified). Surplus S = N/D where D = product of f1,f2 factors < 0 on domain. Need -N >= 0 on semi-algebraic set {disc>=0, f1>0, f2<0}. -N has 233 terms, degree 10 in (a3,a4,b3,b4).

nodes.body_text: Equality point x0=(0,1/12,0,1/12): Hessian eigenvalues 3/4, 21/8, 6, 8 — all positive. Strict local minimum. Taylor radius for -N >= 0: r = 0.004458.
Boundary analysis: f1=0 and f2=0 faces only intersect {disc>=0} at isolated degenerate points where -N=0 (algebraic proof). disc=0 face: min -N ~ 0.06 over 28,309 points (numerical).

nodes.body_text: [FAILED] SOS/Putinar certificates: infeasible at degrees 10, 12, 14. Interior zero of -N fundamentally blocks this approach — at x0, all SOS multipliers must vanish, forcing impossible constraints. This approach CANNOT work regardless of degree.
Case 1 (a3=b3=0): EXACT. Resultant of gradient eqs -> degree-26 univariate. 4 CPs in domain: x0 with -N=0, and 3 saddles with -N = 825, 825, 898. All -N >= 0.

Case 2 (b3=0, a3!=0): EXACT. Parity: g1 odd in a3 -> divide, u=a3^2. Resultant chain -> degree-127 in b4. GCD=(4b4-1)^4*(12a4+1) divided out. Domain: disc_q>=0 forces b4>=0, narrowing search. 6 candidates, 0 interior CPs. 30 seconds.
Key technique: sign-counting replaces Sturm for degree-70 factor. numpy approximate roots + exact rational evaluation at midpoints. 0.2s vs hours for Sturm sequence.
Case 3a (diagonal: a3=b3, a4=b4): EXACT. Exchange symmetry reduces to 2 eqs in 2 unknowns. Parity + resultant -> degree-24 univariate. 1 interior CP with -N = 2296.
Case 3b (anti-diagonal: a3=-b3, a4=b4): EXACT. Exchange+parity -> 2 eqs in 2 unknowns. Resultant -> degree-23 univariate. 2 interior CPs with -N = 0.05 and -N = 686. All -N >= 0.

[PENDING] Case 3c (generic off-diagonal: a3!=0, b3!=0, a3!=+-b3): Full 4D gradient system, 4 polynomials of degree 9. Direct resultant infeasible (~2000 terms). Interval arithmetic failed (wrapping + domain). Numerical: 4 CPs with -N ~ 1679. PHCpack handoff created.

[FAILED] Interval arithmetic: naive IA only certified 6.7% of boxes (wrapping error). Centered form: Hessian Frobenius norm ~96M makes quadratic correction ~35,762 per box. Also domain-unaware: -N < 0 outside semi-algebraic set.

n=4 proof COMPLETE via Path 2: 3-piece Cauchy-Schwarz decomposition 1/Phi_4 = T1+T2+R. T1_surplus >= 0 by Titu's lemma. T2+R surplus = K_red (487 terms) >= 0 by P-convexity: K_red = A(P,Q)+sqrt(PQ)*B(P,Q), B<=0 (bilinear corners), d²K/dP² >= 0 (two non-negative terms), boundary K >= 0 (AM-GM). Bypasses case-by-case critical point analysis entirely.

nodes.body_text: [PROVED] n=4 Path 2 algebraic certificate. K_red = A(P,Q) + sqrt(PQ)*B(P,Q) where P=p^2, Q=q^2. B bilinear with all 4 corners <= 0. d²K/dP² = 2(a20+a12Q) + sqrt(Q)*N(P,Q)/(4P^{3/2}), both terms >= 0. N bilinear with 4 positive corners; hardest corner N(Pmax,0) proved via inner polynomial decomposition by r-powers (discriminant analysis of irreducible quadratics, including case split at y=1/3). Boundary K(0,Q) >= 0 and K(Pmax,Q) >= 0 (AM-GM on F^2 >= 36r(1-x)(1-y)). Convexity + boundary => K >= 0 on full rectangle. Opposite-sign case by C1*(p+q)^2+C0 decomposition.

hx/content.match: K_red = A(P,Q) + sqrt(PQ)*B(P,Q) where P=p^2, Q=q^2
